answerText: Lagrangian[10] The Lagrangian for the "true" trajectory of a dynamical system is the one that minimizes this quantity, the integral of the Lagrangian with respect to time.
heading: ICCS |2014 | 9 | 23 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: For simple systems this quantity is usually given as the difference between kinetic and potential energy.  [10] Identify this quantity from dynamical systems theory from which the equations of motion can be obtained by solving equations co-named for Euler and this quantity's French namesake.
